Create a PostgreSQL Connection Configuration as a Dictionary

make_postgres_connection.Rd

This function generates a PostgreSQL connection configuration using a named list, which can be used directly for database connection functions.

Usage

make_postgres_connection(
  host = "localhost",
  dbname,
  port = 5432,
  user,
  password
)

Arguments

host

The host of the database. Defaults to 'localhost' for a local PostgreSQL database, but can also accept an IP address (e.g., '192.168.1.1').

dbname

The name of the PostgreSQL database. This parameter is required.

port

The port on which the PostgreSQL server is running. Defaults to 5432.

user

A valid database user name. This parameter is required.

password

The password for the specified user. This parameter is required.

Value

A named list representing the PostgreSQL connection configuration.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example with explicit parameters
connection_dict <- make_postgres_connection(
  host = 'localhost',
  dbname = 'mydatabase',
  port = 5432,
  user = 'myuser',
  password = 'mypassword'
  )

# Use the connection dictionary in other functions
elsar_load_data(
  file_name = 'postgres',
  db_info = connection_dict
  )
} # }
